answer.explanation:
M: Hi, Ms. Parker? This is Joseph sterling from Green Creek Realtors. We need to talk about an issue with the apartment you wanted.
W: Oh, hi Joseph. Did you manage to find me a place in the Kahlua Apartment building?
M: Yes, that’s the reason I’m calling. But there is a bit of an issue.
W: Really? What is it?
M: There is a major pest problem in the building, and they need to clear the whole building and carry out pest control. It’s going to take them at least three months to make sure the building is clean. So you would have to wait three months to get a place there...
W: I see...
M: There is a building just nearby called Graceville Towers. It’s very close to the Kahlua building so you could stay there for three months then move over to the Kahlua building. I will arrange ail of the moving for you. Why don’t you go online and check out Graceville Towers and get back to me?
W: Sure, that sounds good. Thanks Joseph.

question.text: What is the reason for Joseph’s call?
choices: (A) There is a problem with the apartment.
(B) To sign the contract for the apartment
(D) To discuss the price of rent

answer.text: (A) There is a problem with the apartment.

question.text: What does Joseph say about the Kahlua Apartment?
choices: (A) It’s ready to move in anytime.
(C) It is near a new fitness center.
(D) There is a major pest problem.

answer.text: (D) There is a major pest problem.

question.text: What does Joseph offer to do?
choices: (A) Find a new apartment at Graceville Towers
(D) Move into the Kahlua Apartment building

W-Br: Hi, Mr. Pork. Thanks for meeting with me.
M-Au: Sure. It’s a pleasure. So, Q1 you’re writing an article for Forge Ahead Magazine?
W-Br: Yes, Q2 the piece is about how your car manufacturing plant dramatically changed the way it produces cars. Could you tell me about what you did?
M-Au: Certainly. Many factory employees are told to never stop production line – no matter what. Q3 Recently I took the opposite approach. Whenever we found a defect, anyone could stop the assembly line and address the problem immediately.
W-Br: Q3 And this transition improved your quality control?
M-Au: Exactly. In fact, look at this production chart. You’ll see that, 67 compared to the other factories, cars from this one have far fewer defects.

What happened recently at mr. Polk's factory?

answer.explanation: Welcome to the Hoffman Textiles Facto tour. As most of you know, our factory provides quality fabrics to clothing manufacturers around the world. During the tour of the facility, you'll see the care that goes into making each of our many types of fabrics. Now, normally we’d start by showing you how fabric is made on the weaving machines, but another tour group is still in that area. So today we’ll start in the final packaging room and do the tour in reverse, visiting the weaving machines at the end. Then we can offer you a 10% discount on fabric purchases today only.

answer.explanation: (M-Cn) I'm so glad you could all join me this evening in honoring Ms. Aviva Rozen. After twenty-five years of working with us at Crown Software, Q1 Aviva is retiring from her position as chief software developer our healthcare applications group was established by Aviva. Q2 Under her strong leadership, that division has become one of our most profitable areas. We're sorry to lose her, but we know she'll enjoy the years ahead. In fact, Q3 she says she'll be found in her home studio, where she'll finally have the time she wants to devote to her watercolor painting.

answer.explanation: Do you regularly use videoconferencing to connect with colleagues working in other locations? Well, then Connectivity 3.0 is the program for you. Q2 With normal videoconferencing systems, you need to set up special phone numbers, various access codes, and special equipment for your meeting. Aren’t there better ways to use your time? Q1 With Connectivity 3.0, just download our application onto your smartphone or tablet and you're ready to immediately join your videoconference. Q3 Visit our Web site to watch a step-by-step video of how easy it is to use. Connectivity 3.0—simplify collaboration.

Transcript:
Hello, passengers. This is an announcement from your conductor. Due to a freight train stalled at the next station, our departure will be delayed. The train ahead of US seems to be suffering a slight malfunction. Once we receive official permission from the traffic control center, we will proceed as normal. Unfortunately, we will arrive a little bit later than the scheduled arrival time. We apologize for this inconvenience. Please adjust your plans accordingly. Thank you for your patience. We should be on the move shortly.

question.text: Where does the announcement most likely take place?

What does the speaker suggest listeners do?

answer.explanation: M-Cn: Before you leave for your first service calls of the day, I have an important announcement. 80 Hereat Quality Plumbing, we've been using paper invoices for years. 80,81 Unfortunately, we've had some billing errors because the information you write down on your invoices is often hard to read. 80 So, each technician will be provided with a laptop computer to use while at the job site. It'll allow you to enter all the information for the work invoice. Training sessions on how to use the new system will begin next week. 82 Sometime today, please stop by my office to sign up for a session.

question.text: What is the main purpose of the announcement?
choices: (B) To celebrate the signing of a contract
(C) To ask staff to check their work for errors
(D) To describe a new company procedure

answer.text: (D) To describe a new company procedure

answer.explanation: Hello, my name is Rick Dunn. I was in your store today and I’m worried I may have left my wallet there. Earlier today I was in the home furniture section looking at some couches. I think my wallet may have slipped out of my pocket while sitting on one of the couches. If you could please look for it, I would really appreciate it. I’d like to stop by your store when you open it at 9:00 A.M. tomorrow. I hope you have good news for me. My phone number is 023-555-6541. Thank you in advance.

(C) When he presented his ID card

question.text: What does the speaker plan to do?

answer.explanation: We’re very happy to welcome you to the historic city of Brantford and to have you join us on one of our tours today. The entire trip will take most of the afternoon. We’ll start with a fairly short tour of the city center area, driving by the main landmarks there and that will take us about half an hour or so. Q1 You’ll see the city’s distinctive architecture, dating back to the late eighteenth century. And Q2 we’ll stop briefly at the government buildings before leaving the city center. Then, after we leave the city, we’ll cross one of the oldest suspension bridges in the world. We’ll proceed to the National Museum of Art, Q3 and then to our highly regarded weather observatory. If you have any questions, feel free to address them to me at any time. Now, let’s begin our tour.

question.text: What does the speaker say about Brantford?
What landmark is located in the center of the city?
What landmark will be visited last?

answer.explanation: Welcome to WBY Radio’s weekly small business report. Our first story is about recent developments in Rider Industries, the country’s leading manufacturer of cleaning supplies. Last year Rider’s market research team found that many consumers preferred to use products that are safe for the environment. As a result, Rider introduced a line of all-natural cleaning supplies. The new line of Green products has been so successful that Rider’s sales have gone up by 19 percent. The company forecasts even greater profits after it launches a digital and print advertising campaign in September

question.text: What does Rider Industries make?
What do customers like about the new line of merchandise?
choices: (D) It comes in a variety of sizes.

question.text: According to the speaker, what will happen in September?
choices: (A) A live radio interview will be held.
(B) An advertising campaign will be launched.
(C) An international trade show will take place.
(D) A company-wide training program will begin.

answer.text: (B) An advertising campaign will be launched.

answer.explanation: Q1 This is a reminder that legendary soccer player Tommy Durant will be signing autographs at Dave’s Sport Shop at 1:00 P.M. tomorrow. Q2 You are encouraged to bring your own items, such as clothes or books, for Mr. Durant to autograph. Also at this time, parents will be able to sign their children up for a summer soccer camp that will be run by Tommy Durant. Q3 The camp is limited to twenty children, so anyone who is interested should sign up early.

choices: (A) To announce the results of a soccer match
(B) To promote a store's grand opening
(D) To inform the listeners of a special event

answer.text: (D) To inform the listeners of a special event

question.text: What does the speaker suggest doing?
What does the speaker say about the summer camp?
choices: (C) It has a restricted number of participants.
(D) It will be sponsored by Dave's Sport Shop.

answer.text: (C) It has a restricted number of participants.

answer.explanation: Hi, everybody. This Saturday, the fitness center will be upgrading our water heating system in the bathrooms. Unfortunately, the hot water will be off from 9:00 A.M. to 12:00 P.M. If anyone was planning to come in and exercise, you might want to hold off until later . If the work gets delayed, I will send a text message to all club members to notify you of any changes.

question.text: What problem does the speaker mention?
choices: (C) The center will have no hot water.

answer.text: (C) The center will have no hot water.

question.text: What does the speaker imply when he says, “you might want to hold off until later”?
choices: (A)  Members of the center should come in the afternoon.
(B) Members of the center shouldn’t come.
(C) There will be a meeting in the morning.
(D) The center is closed in the afternoon.

answer.text: (A)  Members of the center should come in the afternoon.

question.text: What does the speaker say he will do?
Greenleaf Press will soon publish a ___ pocket version of Manuel Santiago's book An Insider's Guide to Travel in Argentina.

answer.explanation: Condensed = Made smaller = Shortened

question.text: Mr. Hong will outline the procedures for handling customers’  _____  information.

answer.explanation: Before the blank is possessive, after that is the noun, so before information needs an adjective

question.text: Roxy Koenig is_____  seeking a new venue for her summer concert since the Hazelton Music Hall is being renovated.

answer.explanation:
Before blank there is tobe- "is", behind the void is the verb V-ing "seeking".
=>Use Adverbs To Modify Verbs

question.text: The estimated production costs for the new Pro Tip markers will be $2.15 per set, excluding the cost ___ the packaging.

answer.explanation: Cost of st

question.text: ------- he is usually quiet around the office, Mr. Heineman is known for his witty and engaging public speeches.

answer.explanation: It is necessary to fill in a conjunction that is suitable in meaning to connect the two clauses.

question.text: Ever since Mr. Derrick joined the staff, Mr. Zapata and Ms. Coleman have ___ the marketing team for its excellent results.

answer.explanation:
Praise sb for st = Compliment sb on st
Because the answer goes with "have" so the verb uses either present perfect continuous tense or present perfect tense. However, the verb in passive voice needs to go with "for" instead of the object so we choose "been praising".

question.text: The box office at Edger Concert Hall stops selling tickets approximately fifteen minutes after the performances ___ .

answer.explanation: The previous verb uses simple present tense so we use simple present tense for the answer, too.

question.text: At the end of the year, the company puts ___ a picnic for the employees.

answer.explanation: (D) “Put on” is a two-word verb that in this context means to “produce”. The other prepositions in Choices (A), (B), and (C) do not fit the context of the sentence.

question.text: After investing heavily in Internet marketing campaigns, Bailey Coffee increased its annual profits  _____  fifteen percent.

answer.explanation: The "increase" verb usually only comes with 2 prepositions "to" and "by".

question.text: Gessen Contractors guarantees customers top-quality handiwork on every job, ------- of how small.

answer.explanation:
Questions about the phrase

Regardless of

question.text: Mr. Ling has ------- requested funding for airport terminal improvements.

answer.explanation: It is easy to see that the current usage has completed so you can use yet or already. However, this sentence has a positive meaning so it is already selected

question.text: Mr. Kang started ___ printing business 25 years ago in Pusan, South Korea.

answer.explanation: The answer comes before a noun so we use "his".

question.text: To  _____  the monthly payment for the mortgage, Mr. Tyler would need a substantial salary increase.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=>D

question.text: The company has quit___in that magazine.

answer.explanation: (C) “Quit” is followed by a gerund. Choice (A) is an infinitive. Choice (B) is base form. Choice (D) is a noun.

question.text: The Master Gardeners Club had to _____ its monthly meeting because the community center’s conference room was double-booked.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of sentence. We have a hitn that "because the community center’s conference room was double-booked."
=> Choose C

question.text: Lawton Airways has announced that it will ___ increase its nonstop service from Cransen to Hopley City.

answer.explanation: Substantially = Greatly

question.text: If you are not satisfied with your purchase ------- CXT Electronics, return it within 30 days for a full refund.

answer.explanation: The verb "purchase" means "to buy, buy" so it will go with the preposition from.

question.text: The use of umbrellas is prohibited in the sports stadium because they obstruct the view of  ___.

answer.explanation:
Others = Other people
Obstruct = Block

question.text: The best method for improving the _____  of your home at little cost is giving the exterior a fresh coat of paint.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=>B

question.text: The artist sent _____ best pieces to the gallery to be reviewed by the owner

answer.explanation:
The blank is after a verb and before an adjective so an adverb or an adjective is suitable. In the answers given, his is a possessive adjective.
We have the structure article/possessive adj + adj + N
=> Choose C

question.text: The Pontilet 5000 quickly calculates the shortest ___ to your destination and provides step-by-step directions.

answer.explanation: Route = Road = Way

question.text: If the product were not safe, we ___ it.

answer.explanation: (D) An unreal condition requires “would” in the clause without “if” Choice (A) is the wrong tense. Choices (B) and (C) do not use “would”.

question.text: On July 23, Mr. Saito will be named chairman of the board ___ president of Tairex Electronics.

answer.explanation: As well as = And also

question.text: This memo is ___ the previous one.

answer.explanation: (C) Equal comparisons use as + adjective + as; “the memo” is causing people to become confused, so the adjective must be the present participle. Choice (A) omits the second “as”. Choice (B) omits the first “as”. Choice (D.) uses the past participle.

question.text: All receipts for travel expenses should be ___ to Mr. Franconi for processing before the end of the month.

answer.explanation: Submit st to sb = Give st to sb

question.text: Koffler Law hired more paralegals ………………………….. meet its ommitment to clients.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning to choose the correct answer
=> B

question.text: We___in the elevator when the electricity went out, and we were stuck there for almost an hour.

answer.explanation: (B) The past continuous form indicates an action that was in progress when another action (the electricity went out) occurred. Choice (A) is simple past tense. Choice (C) is past participle. Choice (D) is past perfect.

question.text: If fuel costs rise ___ , the terms of our contract may have to be renegotiated.

answer.explanation: Significantly = Greatly

question.text: Operating instructions are posted above the printer so you can _____ refer to them.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=> D
Easily add meaning to the phrase "refer to"

question.text: The Zans Corporation  _____  manufacturing all of its luxury wallets and footwear domestically next year.

answer.explanation:
We've got signal words of future tense "next year"
=> Choose C

question.text:
To: HYPERLINK "mailto.jroux@xmail.com
From: josephbelle@perilleuxrealestate.com
Date: March 2
Subject: Your job inquiry
Dear Ms. Roux,
Your resume—1. —- to me by a colleague. -—2.—. We appreciate your interest in Perilleux Real Estate and will keep your—3.—- on file in case a full-time position opens up in the future.
—4.—, would you consider working for us part-time on a special project? Our CEO needs administrative support on an ambitious advertising campaign. The project should last until the end of July.
Kindly let me know if this opportunity interests you.
Sincerely,
Joseph Belle, Vice President
Human Resources

answer.explanation: In this case, use passive form => was passed on

choices: (A)It was nice to meet you at the networking event.
(B)Our firm is now six years old.
(C)We are happy to have you as part of our team.
(D)Unfortunately, we do not have an open receptionist position.

answer.text: (D)Unfortunately, we do not have an open receptionist position.
answer.explanation: Select the correct answer based on around sentences.
Based on the meaning of the words to choose the correct answer
Based on the meaning of the words to choose the correct answer

question.text:
Question 131-134 refer to the following article.

Bakery Gets TechnologicalMOMBASA (June 10) - Incredible Cravings, a nationwide bakery and pastry chain with more than 28 store locations, (131.) ------- a new way to use technology to better serve its customers. During the last quarter, the company began using an infrared-sensor system that (132.) ------- monitors products in the store as they are added ad removed from shelves.

Personnel from each bakery can see (133.) ------- in real time as it is analyzed and updated by the computer. (134.) -------. For example, when many customers purchase a certain type of bread, employees who are monitoring the screen can immediately restock the popular item.

answer.explanation: It can be seen in this sentence that there is no specific timeframe for the present, past or future. Therefore, the verb in the sentence cannot be divided in the perfect past continuous or future perfect tenses. On the other hand, the meaning of this sentence is referring to the result of an action "a new way to use technology", so using the present perfect tense is possible.
Position needs to precede the verb, so it lacks an adverb to complement the verb.
Vocabulary questions. Need to rely on the meaning of the words to choose the correct answer.

choices: (A)This system ensures that shoppers can always find what they want.
(B)This computer sends data to store security staff.
(C)The Mombasa store is gaining more and more customers.
(D)The most popular item at Incredible Cravings is the chocolate croissant

answer.text: (A)This system ensures that shoppers can always find what they want.
answer.explanation: The following sentence shows an example that when multiple customers purchase an item, the employee can immediately get the favorite item on the shelf. This means the system helps customers always find the goods they want, without worrying about running out of stock.

question.text:
To:Janet Doe
From:Greenscape
Date:June 28
Subject:Inquiry

Ms. Doe,
We thank you for your inquiry. Greenscape has been the leading landscaper for businesses in the greater downtown area for over 10 years. (1) _____ we specialize in gardens and Japanese- style landscape art, we also maintain lawns and fields. But to answer your question, yes, we even clear away thick shrubbery and trees. We can send a person to (2) _____ the amount of time it will take and the approximate costs. Furthermore, if you (3) _____ to replace the dense shrubs with a lawn or garden, you can work with one of our designers to come up with a landscape you can be happy with.
(4) _____ We are more than happy to serve you.
(1) _____ we specialize in gardens and Japanese- style landscape art, we also maintain lawns and fields.

answer.explanation: Sign: "also" in the following clause -> select Although

question.text: We can send a person to (2) _____ the amount of time it will take and the approximate costs.

answer.explanation: Base on meaning to choose the correct answer

question.text: Furthermore, if you (3) _____ to replace the dense shrubs with a lawn or garden, you can work with one of our designers to come up with a landscape you can be happy with.

answer.explanation: conditional sentence type 1 -> select B

question.text: (4) _____ We are more than happy to serve you.
choices: (A) We welcome any business opportunity with you.
(B) Please don’t hesitate to email any questions you have.
(C) Please call us at 555-1245 if you are interested in a consultation.
(D) Visit our website for more information.

answer.text: (C) Please call us at 555-1245 if you are interested in a consultation.
answer.explanation: Base on meaning to choose the correct answer

question.text:
To: All staff
From: Louise Nixon, Director of operations
Subject: VIP event

We have confirmed a booking for over 200 guests from September 27 to 30. Many of ---1---are important people from respected organizations who anticipate a high level of service from us.
They will be our only guests over the entire four-day period. For privacy reasons, you are expected to cooperate with requests from their security personnel and ---2---from discussing the event outside the hotel. ---3---. We've also agreed that guests will be allowed complimentary use of the spa, gym, and business center. –-4---, they should be billed if they order room service or make long-distance calls.

answer.explanation: By phrase "many of them"
Based on the parallel structure of the verbs in the sentence => A is correct.

choices: (A) The guests were very pleased with the service we provided.
(B) Another group needs to use our small meeting room on the 28th.
(C) The contract states that their meals should be provided free of charge.
(D) Event participants will be entitled to a discount upon booking.

answer.explanation: Based on the previous sentence.
Use a suitable conjunction to to express two different ideas.

question.text:
MEMO

From: Eun Mi Ha, CEO
To: All Employees Subject: January 10 Meeting
Date: January 13

As announced at the company meeting on January 10, we will be changing the regular work hours for most employees as part of our initiative to reduce energy costs. Since our energy costs are generally higher in the late afternoon, it will be to our advantage to perform more work in the morning. Therefore, beginning on Monday, February 24, the workday will officially start at 8:00 A.M. instead of 9:00 A.M., and it will end at 4:00 PM. instead of 5:00 PM. The last day of the old schedule will be Friday, February 21, and the office will close at 5:00 P.M. on that day.

Employees in the accounting department will not be affected by the change, since their schedule is determined by normal banking hours.
What are employees asked to do?
choices: (C) Take a shorter break in the afternoon
(D). Submit their time sheets to the accounting department

answer.explanation: Information in the sentence: "As announced at the company meeting on January 10, we will be changing the regular work hours for most employees as part of our initiative to reduce energy costs."

question.text: When will the change go into effect?

answer.explanation: Information in the sentence: "Therefore, beginning on Monday, February 24, the workday will officially start at 8:00 A.M. instead of 9:00 A.M., and it will end at 4:00 PM. instead of 5:00 PM. "

question.text:
Community Victory


After a months-long battle to stop the development of a new shopping mall on the location of the former Rivervalley Courthouse, residents, local businesses, and civic groups are cheering the decision to keep the 150-year-old building intact. - [1] - “We’re dissappointed,” added Branford Construction's CEO. “We felt that the community would benefit and grow, but obviously, residents want to preserve their history and I respect that.”
Instead, efforts are being made to restore the old deserted courthouse to its former glory. - [2] - “The community is getting together for this and we are collecting donations to have the building renovated,” said local resident Enid Tran. "We hope to make a public library or school out of the building.”
- [3] - “It’s been here for as long as I can remember. In fact, my grandfather worked as a clerk there,” added a local business owner, Kevin Lamb. “It’s an iconic symbol of our community and we don’t want it destroyed.” The community has already raised over $100,000 through an online petition and donations keep pouring in. - [4] - The community hopes that restoration of the building begins within the next couple of months

In which of the positions marked [1], [2], [3] and [4] does the following sentence belong?
“Branford Construction, the development company that originally planned to build the shopping mall, is looking to build the mall outside of the Rivervalley Community.”

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning => position number 1 is the most reasonable.

question.text: What is suggested about the fundraising efforts?
choices: (A) The community made a lot of money from the land.
(C) The city government has been helping

answer.explanation:
Last paragraph:

The community has already raised over $ 100,000 through an online petition and donations keep pouring in.

question.text: What is indicated about the old courthouse?
choices: (A) Branford Construction wants to renovate the building.
(B) The residents want to turn the building into a shopping mall.
(C) It may become a public library or school.

answer.text: (C) It may become a public library or school.

question.text:
Grand Opening!


The owner of Woodcraft Designs is pleased to announce the opening of her second store in Falls City. The new store will offer high-quality wood furniture, with an emphasis on pieces made to customer specifications. Abigail Hurst, who opened the original Woodcraft Designs location on High Street five years ago, leads a small team of experienced, talented furniture makers whose unique creations will be displayed in both stores. Although Hurst’s pieces cover a range of styles and periods, the new store will showcase the company’s remarkable replicas of Victorian-style furniture made from fine quality cherry, oak, and mahogany woods.

Hurst’s craftwork has earned her a reputation as a master artisan in her field. Her reconstruction of a nineteenth-century dressing table was the subject of a lengthy article in Classics of Woodwork on methods and techniques of precision woodcutting. In addition, photographs of some of her best pieces have appeared in Today’s Space, which features information about houses and buildings that are known for their impressive furnishings and decor. Ms. Hurst will divide her time between the old and new store locations.
What is the purpose of the notice?
choices: (A)To announce the publication of a new book
(B)To describe a recent trend in architecture
(D)To invite people to apply for a job

answer.explanation: Information in the sentences: "The new store will offer high-quality wood furniture, with an emphasis on pieces made to customer specifications. Abigail Hurst, who opened the original Woodcraft Designs location on High Street five years ago, leads a small team of experienced, talented furniture makers whose unique creations will be displayed in both stores. Although Hurst’s pieces cover a range of styles and periods, the new store will showcase the company’s remarkable replicas ofVictorian-style furniture made from fine quality cherry, oak, and mahogany woods."

question.text: Who Is Ms. Hurst?

answer.explanation: "Although Hurst’s pieces cover a range of styles and periods, the new store will showcase the company’s remarkable replicas ofVictorian-style furniture made from fine quality cherry, oak, and mahogany woods." and "Hurst’s craftwork has earned her a reputation as a master artisan in her field." => It can inferred that Ms. Hurst is a furniture maker

question.text: What are the articles in Today's Space mostly about?

answer.explanation: Based on words like  Woodcraft Designs,  wood furniture, furniture makers, craftwork, furnishings and decor, etc. Besides, you need to skim the passage to answer this question.

question.text:
Prendis National Park Authority (PNPA)

Prendis National Park includes mainland shore areas and Prendis Island itself. Please note, however, that additional restrictions will be in force for accessing the island this summer. Unless they are members of an official tour, visitor visitors to the Park will be prohibited from setting foot on Prendis Island. This rule also applies to individuals who may wish to visit the island independently using private watercraft. Such individuals may review the island from the water and may anchor offshore, but must not make landfall on the island.

The PNPA’s official boat tours for visitors to the island are offered seven days a week throughout the year and depart at two hour time intervals starting at 8 A.M. The final tour leaves at 4 P.M, except for the summer months of December through March, when this is extended to 6 P.M. Call 08 9776 5992 to make reservations. The official tour includes a brief visit to the island itself, where you can view bird-nesting areas with a PNPA park ranger as your authorized escort.

Payment and Reservations
• Tours are capped at 18 participants. If your group is smaller than 15, we reserve the right to include other visitors in your tour,
• Tickets are $20 per person for those 12 years of age and over and $10 per child under the age of 12.
• A nonrefundable deposit of $5 per person is required to hold a reservation for groups. Your deposit will be credited to your total group admission fee. If your party does not arrive at the specified time, we reserve the right to shorten the trip as necessary in order to avoid interfering with subsequent tours. Rescheduling cannot be considered.
What is announced in the notice?

answer.explanation: “Please note, however, that additional restrictions will be in force for accessing the island this summer.”

question.text: What is indicated about visiting Prendis Island?
choices: (A) Visitors are warned not to disturb the wildlife.
(B) To tour on foot, visitors must be accompanied by a guide.
(C) Visitors are not permitted to swim near the island.
(D) To view the island from a boat, visitors must join an official tour.

answer.text: (B) To tour on foot, visitors must be accompanied by a guide.
answer.explanation:
“Unless they are members of an official tour, visitors to the park will be prohibited from setting foot on Prendis Island.”
“The official tour includes a brief visit to the island itself, where you can view bird-nesting areas with a PNPA park ranger as your authorized escort.”

question.text: What is NOT mentioned about the PNPA's tours?

answer.explanation:
“Tours are capped at 18 participants.”
“A nonrefundable deposit of $5 person is required to hold a reservation for groups”
“The final tour leaves at 4 P.M., except for the summer months of December through March.”

question.text: According to the notice, what may happen if a group arrives late for a scheduled tour?
choices: (B) It may last less than two hours.
(D) It may be moved to another day‘

answer.text: (B) It may last less than two hours.
answer.explanation:
“The PNPA’s official boat tours for visitors to the island are offered seven days a week throughout the year and depart at two-hour intervals starting at 8 A.M.”
“If your party does not arrive at the specified ti we reserve the right to shorten the trip as necessary in order to avoid interfering with subsequent tours.”

question.text:
Bill Flake (9:41)
Hello, I'd like to get an update on the progress of the drapes that the Manillo Family ordered.
Lucy Mitt (9:41)
We're still waiting for the lace silks from Hand-Made Lace but we received most of the other fabrics yesterday. Our seamstresses will get to work on those today.
Bill Flake (9:42)
Then do you think the project will be completed by this Friday as the Manillo's wanted?
Lucy Mitt (9:43)
I'm not sure. It'll depend on when the lace arrives. Our group can start sewing some of the pieces together, but we need the lace to complete the intricate designs.
Bill Flake (9:44)
Can you contact Hand-Made Lace and find out when the shipment arrives?
Lucy Mitt (9:45)
Actually, Richard is taking care of that. Any word from them, Richard?
Richard Choi (9:45)
Yes, I just got off the phone with them. There was a bit of a delay because the lace artisans used the wrong silks. They had to re-work the lace. We'll receive them this afternoon. They sent a rush delivery to US.
Bill Flake (9:46)
Excellent. Then can the drapes be finished at the end of this week?
Lucy Mitt (9:47)
No problem. We'll work around the clock to get them finished on time.
Bill Flake (9:48)
I'm glad to hear that. They are long-time customers and they needed the drapes for their new condo this weekend.
What kind of business do the participants in the online chat probably work at?

answer.explanation: The information is in: "Hello, I'd like to get an update on the progress of the drapes that the Manillo Family ordered."

question.text: When will the shipment of lace arrive?
choices: (D) At the end of the week

answer.explanation: The information can be inferred from: "They had to re-work the lace. We'll receive them this afternoon."

question.text: At 9:47, what does Lucy Mitt mean when she says, “We’ll work around the clock”?
choices: (A) Her team will watch the time carefully.
(B) Her team will work as quickly as possible.
(C) Her team will take as much time as they need.
(D) Her team will work all day and night if they have to.

answer.text: (D) Her team will work all day and night if they have to.
answer.explanation:
around the clock: happening or done all day and all night
If something is done around the clock or round the clock, it is done all day and all night without stopping.

question.text: What will Bill Flake probably do next?

answer.explanation: In the first message Bill wanted to get update on progress of the drapes that the Manilo Family ordered, it can be inferred from that he will call the Manilo family and let them know about the progress.

question.text:
MEMO

To:All Employees
From:Betty Franklin, General Manager
Date:August 19

To all employees:
- [1] - Greta Jones, the receptionist at our studio will be taking some time off to deal with a personal matter. She will be gone from August 21st to September 5th. - [2] - Ms. Blanche will take care of the regular responsibilities that Ms. Jones usually handles including taking phone calls, handling appointments, organizing schedules, and dealing with clients. Please welcome Ms. Blanche to the studio and be available for her to ask questions if she has any.
Furthermore, if you have any long time clients that you give special prices and discounts to, please let Ms. Blanche know ahead of time. - [3] - She will charge the fees that are programmed into the computer system.
If you have any urgent concerns you need to discuss with Ms. Jones, or if you need to purchase any special hair dyes, treatment shampoos, or other requests that customers have, please do so today and tomorrow before she leaves. –[4]- You can contact me at any time if you have any further questions.

question.text: What is indicated about Greta Jones?
choices: (C) She will take some time off work.

answer.text: (C) She will take some time off work.
answer.explanation: Information is in: "Greta Jones, the receptionist at our studio will be taking some time off to deal with a personal matter."

question.text: By when should employees contact Ms. Jones with urgent business?

question.text:

question.text:
To: Sam Berry sberry@princertheater.com
From: Bessie Wagner bessiewagner@linsuniversity.edu
Date: July 4
Subject: Openings

Dear Mr. Berry,
My name is Bessie Wagner and I am currently a student in the theater department at Lins University. I have almost finished my degree, and I am starting to look into possible career opportunities for my future. A professor of mine recommended that I contact you at the Prince Theater to ask about possible positions at your company.
At Lins University, I specialized in the production elements of theater. Through both academic and practical experiences, I learned the useful skills necessary for stage management. As of September, I will be available to work either part-time or full-time and apply myself fully to whatever task is assigned to me.
I would really appreciate it if you let me know if there are any available positions starting this fall.
Bessie Wagner


===========================
 

Prince Theater

Job Openings

• Artistic Intern
Unpaid internship in the artistic department in all aspects of administration and production. This person will perform assistant duties for the artistic director.

• Assistant Technical Director
Part-time position responsible for production management and stage machinery. Applicants should have related experience in stage management.

• Director of Ticket Operations
Full-time position responsible for overall management of ticket operations for all events taking place at the theater. Responsibilities include box office operations as well as planning and implementing all ticket sales processes, and supervision of the ticketing staff.

• Marketing Director
Full-time position responsible for marketing concerning all of the productions put on by the theater. Oversee the preparation of high-quality promotional materials to attract theatergoers to our plays, musicals, and concerts.

- All full-time employees of Prince Theater are eligible for complimentary access to all productions.
- All of the positions will be open starting this October.
- For more information or to apply, contact Sam Berry by e-mail at sberry@princetheater.com.
What is indicated about Ms. Wagner?
choices: (B) She teaches classes on stage design.

answer.explanation: “I have almost finished my degree, and I am starting to look into possible career opportunities for my future”.

question.text: Why did Ms. Wagner write to Mr. Berry?
choices: (D) To register for a training course

answer.explanation: “A professor of mine recommended that I contact you at the Prince Theater to ask about possible positions as at your company.”

question.text: What is NOT suggested about the Director of Ticket Operations?
choices: (A) He or she has to manage various types of events.
(B) He or she must direct the work of other employees.
(C) He or she can watch any shows free of charge.
(D) He or she must plan promotional events.

answer.text: (D) He or she must plan promotional events.
answer.explanation: “Full-time position responsible for overall management of ticket operations for all events taking place at the theater. Responsibilities include box office operations as well as planning and implementing all ticket sales processes, and supervision of the ticketing staff. ”

question.text: What do all of the advertised jobs have in common?
choices: (B) They will be available in the fourth quarter.
(D) They require a degree in theater.

answer.text: (B) They will be available in the fourth quarter.
answer.explanation: All of the positions will be open starting this October

answer.explanation:
-In Wagner's letter:

"I learned the useful skills necessary for stage management.
I will be available to work either part-time or full - time"

question.text:
New This Week ...................................

After months of editing and several postponed release dates due to production delays, the documentary series The Hidden Side of Architecture finally hits television screens this week. The four-part program directed by Michael Moussa and Tina Erskine looks at little-known facts behind the world's most iconic buildings. Fans of actor and comedian Wesley Fleming will be happy to hear that he is the host for the series. The program was produced by Leif Bergen and will appear on the Knowledge Now channel on the dates below.

============================

EPISODE                                                                                   AIRDATE
1 "Against All Odds"                                                                        April 3
The first part takes us to Ancient Egypt, where builders managed to solve formidable engineering prolems.
2 "Building Without Modern Technology"                                April 10
How, without modern tools and technology, did medieval builders in Europe construct the great cathedrals that dominated cityscapes for nearly a thousand years?
3 "Modern Cities"                                                                             April 17
In this episode, we admire the beauty of modern urban structures, and we learn some gripping stories behind their planning and construction.
4 "Road Ahead"                                                                                 April 24
The last part looks at ideas still in the making: new designs of ever-taller skyscrapers, bio-inspired buildings with smaller footprints, and other marvels that will one day grace our cities.
 

===========================

Drena Kraakevik  ★ ★ ★ ★ ★
After the first episode of The Hidden Side of Architecture, I can only say that I can't wait to see the remaining three parts! Fleming does a tremendous job narrating the story; he's informative yet funny. Don't miss the free downloadable booklet accompanying the series on Knowledge Now's Web site. It's a must-have if you want to learn more about the building featured on the program.
What is indicated about the making of the program?
choices: (C) It was financed by several sponsors.
(D) It involved a large team of producers.

answer.explanation:
First sentence information “After months of editing and several postponed release dates due to production delays” (After months of editing and several delays announcement date due to production delay).
Thus, the production of this show had been delayed several times before its screening, which was longer than originally planned.

question.text: Who appears in the program?

answer.explanation:
Information Fans of actor and comedian Wesley Fleming will be happy to hear that he is the host for the series. ”Fans of actor and comedian Wesley Fleming will be happy to hear that he is the host of the series. series)
So Mr. Fleming will appear on the show because he is the host of this program.

question.text: What episode focuses on the urban planning?

answer.explanation: You can be found in the content information of part 3 about modern cities “and we learn some gripping stories behind their planning and construction” (and we learn about some of the compelling stories behind planning and building them up. ). So this section will provide a lot of information about urban planning

question.text: When did Ms. Kraakevik most likely watch the program?

answer.explanation: Mr. Kraakevik noisng that he watched season 1 and is waiting for the rest of the 3 seasons, so let's compare it to April 3rd.

question.text: What does Ms. Kraakevik recommend doing?
choices: (A) Purchasing movies that feature a particular actor
(B) Visiting the buildings shown in the program
(D) Watching other programs by the same director

answer.explanation: Can be found in the last sentence of Kraakevik's comment: “Don't miss the free downloadable booklet accompanying the series on Knowledge Now's Web site. It's a must-have if you want to learn more about the building featured on the program. ” As such, Ms. Kraakevik recommends looking for more information on the proposed works online.

question.text:
Sunny Day Cleaning

The only choice for your professional cleaning


Bill to
.
.		 Randall Auto Body
957 Pacific Trail Rd.
Troutdale, Oregon 97055		 Invoice #: 2348 Date: March 3

Date Description of Service Amount
February 5 Full-office cleaning (Including: 3 rooms, 2 bathrooms, windows, carpet deep clean, furniture) $95
February 5 Full-office cleaning (Including: 3 rooms, 2 bathrooms, windows, carpet deep clean, furniture) $95


Total: $190

*Payments received after April 1 will be subject to a $20 late charge.

Sunny Day Cleaning

283 Main St.

Troutdale, Oregon 97055


Questions or Additional Services: Please call 1-345-737-2209.



===========================

March 8
Dear Sunny Day Cleaning,

I received your invoice for the services we received in February, which 1 have to say were excellent. I see we were charged $95 dollars for each time you serviced our offices. This is what we had initially agreed upon and have been paying for your services since last j year at this time. However, Rod Sanford told me we’d be receiving a $5 discount each time you visited us because we have arranged for you to clean our other location just off 1 of Hwy. 26. He said that this new price would be starting in February. I have included a copy of the e-mail Rod Sanford sent me. Could you please adjust the price to reflect the new agreement and send US a new bill? I’d appreciate it. We look forward to seeing you again.

Thank you for your assistance,

Patricia Collins
Manager
Randall Auto Body
Why did Ms. Collins write a letter?
choices: (A) The cleaning service missed an appointment.
(B) She was overcharged for a service.
(C) The cleaning service added an extra fee to her bill.
(D) She would like to renew her contract.

answer.text: (B) She was overcharged for a service.

question.text: According to the invoice, what amount is due by April 1 ?
What did Ms. Collins send besides her letter?
choices: (D) A check for the amount due

question.text: What is implied about Sunny Day Cleaning?
choices: (B) They are often late to appointments.

question.text: What service was NOT provided to Randall Auto Body?

To: Dennis Maki
From: Nigella Smith
Date: Thursday, November 8,2:15 P.M.
Subject: Update
Dennis:

The heads of accounting and sales have chosen the finalists for the job openings in their departments here at Plumsted Aynes. Susan Tsai would like to invite Marco Garcia and Danielle Jenkins to return for second interviews for the accounting position, and Rajesh Kapoor wants to invite Melanie Yu for a second interview for the medical sales position.
 
I would like you to call the finalists, schedule interviews with them, and then make lunch arrangements accordingly. Keep in mind that Susan will be out of the office next week for  a conference.
 
Thank you for your assistance with this search so far. I’m especially grateful that you were able to work on a short deadline when I asked you to set up the initial interviews.
Regards,
Nigella Smith
Human Resources Director
 

=========================
To: Nigella Smith
From: Dennis Maki 
Date: Thursday, November 8,3:52 P.M.
Subject: RE: Update

Nigella:

I called the three finalists. As it turns out, this afternoon Melanie Yu accepted a job offer with another pharmaceutical firm—our competitor Granquist. I informed Rajesh about this development and he said he hopes to find a suitable replacement.
 
I have confirmed an interview for Mr. Garcia on Tuesday, November 20. I also made arrangements with our regular catering company for lunch here. Unfortunately, Ms. Jenkins was recently hospitalized, so I’m leaving any further decision  about her interview  with you.
 
Dennis Maki
Administrative Associate
What is one purpose of the first e-mail?
choices: (B)To make an offer to a job applicant

answer.explanation: The first email, paragraph 2: I would like you to call the finalists, ...

question.text: What type of company most likely is Plumsted Aynes?

answer.explanation: The second email, paragraph 1, line 1: .... a job offer with ANOTHER pharmaceutical firm - our COMPETITOR Granquist

question.text: What is suggested about Ms. Jenkins?
choices: (B)She will be interviewed by Ms. Smith.
(D)She is interested in a sales position.

answer.explanation: 1 st email, paragraph 1, line 3: .... big Danielle Jenkins RETURN for second interviews...

question.text: What will Mr. Kapoor most likely do?

answer.explanation: 2 nd email, paragraph 1, last sentence: ..he said he hopes to find a suitable replacement.

question.text: What was Mr. Maki NOT able to do?
choices: (B)Schedule all the appointments within a given time frame
(D)Assist Ms. Smith with setting up the initial interviews

answer.text: (B)Schedule all the appointments within a given time frame
answer.explanation:
2 nd email, paragraph 2:

- Mr. Garcia: Tuesday November 20 

- Catering company for lunch 

- Ms. Jenkins: hospitalized => unable to 'close' all appointments on 1 time frame

question.text:
Chocolatier's Pavilion Mobbed
BERLIN (15 AUGUST) — The International Food Expo kicked off earlier this week, and it quickly became clear which pavilions are attracting the most interest from attendees at the weeklong event. From the moment it opened, the pavilion featuring the Brazilian chocolatier Amo-Te has been overrun with enthusiastic visitors.
"We didn't expect to be so popular," remarked company Marketing Manager Andreas Gomes, who arrived at the expo just in time to see his company's artisanal confectioners explain the chocolate-making process to eager crowds. “ We drew so many visitors that I had to fly in five more employees from our headquarters in Brazil to staff our busy display area.”
Vintage products that Amo-Te no longer distributes to retailers have been released in limited quantities. One exclusively available at the Expo is the once-popular bar made from dried fruit and covered with dark chocolate. The company has reproduced this old favorite in a classic, retro-style wrapper.
“We were confident that our appeal to chocolate-lovers' sense of nostalgia would be welcome,” said Mr. Gomes, “but we never expected this kind of success!”
=================

=================
According to the article, what action did Mr. Gomes have to take?
choices: (C)  Bringing extra workers to the event
(D)  Shipping additional samples to staff at the expo

answer.text: (C)  Bringing extra workers to the event
answer.explanation: “We drew so many visitors that I had to fly in five more employees from our headquarters in Brazil to staff our busy display area.”

question.text: In the article, the word "drew” in paragraph 2, line 6, is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: In the context of this article, it can be seen that the meaning of 3 options A, B, C is inappropriate. The word "drew" here means "attract, attract", the closest meaning to "attracted".

question.text: On what day did Mr. Gomes likely arrive at the expo?

answer.explanation: “remarked company Marketing Manager Andreas Gomes, who arrived at the expo just in time to see his company's artisanal confectioners explain the chocolate-making process to eager crowds."

question.text: Which product was produced specifically for the expo?

answer.explanation: “One exclusively available at the Expo is the once-popular bar made from dried fruit and covered with dark chocolate”....“the legendary dried-fruit and dark-chocolate Carpatho”

question.text: What is indicated about Malayna?
choices: (A) It contains many different types of nuts.
(B) It is not yet available in stores.
(C) It has sold well in recent months.
(D) It is a traditional Brazilian treat.

answer.text: (B) It is not yet available in stores.
answer.explanation: “You can also sample the new Malayna, a bittersweet confection with hints of coconut, debuting in retail locations early next year.”
